publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4029 Murdo Fraser: Stirling’s Labour Administration Cutting Play Projects Budget—That the Parliament applauds the parents and childminders who are campaigning against Stirling Council’s Labour administration’s plan to axe the annual £150,000 "play projects" budget; calls on local Labour councillors to reflect on the strength of opposition, as evidenced by the 700-strong signature petition against their planned cuts; acknowledges that frontline services of this nature can play a vital role in the early learning of children; believes that the current Labour administration’s plans for large council tax rises and cuts to frontline services are unwanted and unnecessary, and calls on it to rethink its proposed budget.

S2M-4029 Stirling’s Labour Administration Cutting Play Projects Budget (lodged on 28 February 2006) Alex Johnstone*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Mr David Davidson*, Margaret Mitchell*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Phil Gallie*, Mary Scanlon*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Bill Aitken*
S2M-4029 Stirling’s Labour Administration Cutting Play Projects Budget (lodged on 28 February 2006) Mr Brian Monteith*

S2M-4029 Murdo Fraser: Stirling’s Labour Administration Cutting Play Projects Budget—That the Parliament applauds the parents and childminders who are campaigning against Stirling Council’s Labour administration’s plan to axe the annual £150,000 "play projects" budget; calls on local Labour councillors to reflect on the strength of opposition, as evidenced by the 700-strong signature petition against their planned cuts; acknowledges that frontline services of this nature can play a vital role in the early learning of children; believes that the current Labour administration’s plans for large council tax rises and cuts to frontline services are unwanted and unnecessary, and calls on it to rethink its proposed budget. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson, Margaret Mitchell, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Phil Gallie, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Nanette Milne, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Bill Aitken, Mr Brian Monteith
S2M-4029 Stirling’s Labour Administration Cutting Play Projects Budget (lodged on 28 February 2006) Robin Harper*
